div.head: For the furnace
div.ab:
A coffer with a stone ten square thumbs in size and one foot thick, pierced in the middle
2 earthenware boxes or pots with a lid
2 small pipes of fer blanc to evacuate the smoke from the furnace
Rapeseed oil for the lamps to heat the furnace
A fire-steel

One lb & a half of vitriol
As much saltpeter
As much rock alum

The glass vessel must be made like a pear or round pyramid, of the thickness of a small knife back, round on the bottom without bending like vials, its opening of such a size that a Dutch quill can just about fit in, & with a lip at the end. Thus of a height of seven fingers' width.
